title: Basis (linear algebra)
summary: In mathematics, a set B of vectors in a vector space V is called a basis if every element of V may be written in a unique way as a finite linear combination of elements of B. The coefficients of this linear combination are referred to as components or coordinates of the vector with respect to B. The elements of a basis are called .mw-parser-output .vanchor>:target~.vanchor-text{background-color:#b1d2ff}basis vectors.
